SEARCH
Package it.astromark.commons.service

Interface CrudService<T,R,RS,ID>

Type Parameters:
T - the entity type
R - the request type for creating or updating an entity
RS - the response type for returning entity details
ID - the identifier type used for the entity
All Known Subinterfaces:
CommunicationService, NoteService, ParentService, SchoolService, SecretaryService, TeacherService, TicketService
All Known Implementing Classes:
CommunicationServiceImpl, NoteServiceImpl, ParentServiceImpl, SchoolServiceImpl, SecretaryServiceImpl, TeacherServiceImpl, TicketServiceImpl
public interface CrudService<T,R,RS,ID>
Generic service interface for managing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    RS
    create(R r)
    Creates a new resource.
    boolean
    delete(ID id)
    Deletes a resource by its ID.
    T
    getById(ID id)
    Retrieves a resource by its ID.
    RS
    update(ID id, R r)
    Updates an existing resource by its ID.

  • Method Details

    • create

      RS create(R r)
      Creates a new resource.
      Parameters:
      r - the resource object to be created
      Returns:
      an `RS` object representing the created resource Pre-condition: The `r` must not be null and must contain valid data for creation. Post-condition: A new resource is created and returned as an `RS` object.

    • update

      RS update(ID id, R r)
      Updates an existing resource by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the resource to be updated
      r - the updated resource data
      Returns:
      an `RS` object representing the updated resource Pre-condition: The `id` must not be null and must refer to an existing resource. The `r` must not be null and must contain valid data for updating. Post-condition: The resource is updated and returned as an `RS` object.

    • delete

      boolean delete(ID id)
      Deletes a resource by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the resource to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if the resource was successfully deleted, false otherwise Pre-condition: The `id` must not be null and must refer to an existing resource. Post-condition: The resource is deleted if it exists, and the method returns true.

    • getById

      T getById(ID id)
      Retrieves a resource by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the resource
      Returns:
      a `T` object representing the resource, or null if not found Pre-condition: The `id` must not be null and must refer to an existing resource. Post-condition: Returns the resource as a `T` object if it exists, otherwise null.
